1. Cell morphology: It is a Gram-positive, non-spore-forming, rod-shaped bacterium.

5. Phylogenetic relationships: Genetic analysis has shown that Alkalibacterium indicireducens is closely related to other Alkalibacterium species, which are commonly found in alkaline environments.

This bacterium's unique metabolic traits and adaptation to alkaline, saline environments make it an interesting subject for further study, particularly in the context of environmental biotechnology and bioremediation applications.
